alert.note: Alert for Inland Indian River; Inland Southern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Osceola; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 4:56PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Indian River, southern Brevard and southeastern Osceola Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 455 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms and an outflow boundary producing gusty winds, along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Camp Holly Fish Camp to 11 miles northeast of Kenansville to near Lake Marian. Movement was east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Palm Bay, Melbourne, Satellite Beach, Malabar and Indialantic. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors!

area.areaDesc: Inland Indian River; Inland Southern Brevard; Mainland Southern Brevard; Osceola; Southern Brevard Barrier Islands
